intro: Boerhavia intermedia, commonly known as redroot sandplum, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial herb that thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are succulent and fleshy, adapted to store water in dry conditions. Boerhavia intermedia is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is considered a characteristic species of desert ecosystems.
